intro: Antidesma japonicum var. robustius, commonly known as the Japanese antidesma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers, which are followed by fleshy, orange-red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in lowland forests or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
